item.title: Women boxers crowned for first time
item.description: The world will watch Thursday as Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt bids to become the first man to win the Olympic sprint double twice -- with compatriot Yohan Blake likely to be the chief obstacle in his path.

item.title: Pistorius reprieved in 4x400m relay
item.description: Double amputee Oscar Pistorius can still dream of landing an Olympic medal after his South African team were awarded a place in Friday's 4x400m relay final despite failing to finish their qualification heat.

item.title: Egypt pours military into North Sinai
item.description: Gunmen attacked a police station Thursday in North Sinai, firing several rounds, the latest in a string of violence raging in the area.

item.title: Ernesto regains its punch in the Gulf
item.description: Tropical Storm Ernesto hugged the southern edge of the Bay of Campeche early Thursday, quickly strengthening in its warm waters, the National Hurricane Center said.

item.title: Cases of new swine flu strain rising
item.description: A new strain of swine flu in humans continues to spread, health officials said Thursday, with more than 100 cases reported.

item.title: 14 bodies found in Mexico
item.description: Mexican authorities found an abandoned van containing 14 bodies along a highway in the central city San Luis Potosi Thursday.

item.title: Nepal acts on Gulf states abuse
item.description: Nepal has banned women under the age of 30 from working in Persian Gulf nations amid increasing concerns over abuse and exploitation.

item.title: Dramatic rescue in Antarctica
item.description: A medical emergency was under way Wednesday at the largest research station in Antarctica, which is the hub of the U.S. Antarctic Program.

item.title: Kids hailed as heroes in temple attack
item.description: Two young children have emerged as heroes after warning others of a gunman on a rampage at their Sikh house of worship in suburban Milwaukee.

item.title: No verdict in China murder trial
item.description: Trial of Gu Kailai, wife of former top Chinese Communist Party official Bo Xilai, adjourns with no verdict announced. She is accused of killing UK businessman Neil Heywood.

item.title: Mars photo shows rover's target
item.description: Mars rover Curiosity beamed back a sweeping color panorama of the planet's surface Thursday, showing the rocky, reddish desert surrounding it and the mountain it will explore in the coming months.

item.title: Passengers record their plane crash
item.description: The video shows the beginning of what was hoped would be a perfect plane ride, with the pilot of a 1940s-era Stinson and his three passengers smiling as the plane rumbles down a dirt runway in rural Idaho.
